content: the penelope beanie is a crochet pattern for a beanie this hat includes a section of alternating shell stiches it is a quick project it uses worsted weight yarn the pattern includes written instructions using standard united states crochet terminology it has been tech-edited and tested sizing and gauge sizes adult m finished measurements 21 in circumference at brim 7 5 from top of hat to edge of brim gauge rounds 1 - 3 = 3 5 in diameter crochet supplies needed yarn worsted weight #4 medium approximately 135 yards shown above adult m in universal yarns uptown worsted hues 100% acrylic 180yd 165m /3 5oz 100g #3306 painted desert approximately 3/4 skein adult m in sirdar jewelspun 100% acrylic 546yd 500m /7oz 200g #0848 glowing garniet approximately 1/4 skein hook size i/9 5 5 mm or size needed to obtain gauge notions tapestry needle 1 stitch marker tape measure stitch key bpdc back post double_crochet chain s chain s double_crochet double_crochet dcblo double_crochet back loop only fpdc front post double_crochet repeat repeat round round st s stitch es special stitch abbreviations instructions and tutorial 5-double_crochet shell work 5 double_crochet in one st notes * hat is worked from the top down * it is recommended to use the stitch marker to mark the first st of each round and move the marker up as you go along * adjust the hat s height by subtracting or adding to the number of rounds in the repeat section or by adding additional rounds of ribbing at the end * learn more about back loop only crochet stitches at https //craftingeachday com/what-is-blo-in-crochet/ 1 * chain 1 or chain 2 at beginning of each round does not count as a stitch please note that the pattern is available for free on my blog the benefit of purchasing this
